greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least prime of the form k^n + n with k>1, 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: No primes of the form k^n + n exist for n in A097792.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
example: a(3) = 11 because 2^3 + 3 = 11 is the least prime that can be expressed as k^3 + 3, k > 1.
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Apr 23 2018
